metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6416 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in net/ceph/auth_x.c in Ceph, as used in the Linux kernelbefore 3.16.3, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption and panic) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a longunencrypted auth ticket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6416` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-37.64

linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-37.64

linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-37.64
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-37.64').

linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
